questions.text: Abortion should be legal.
Abortion should not be legal.
A woman must be able to control her body, including the right to terminate a fetus.
An unborn child's life must be protected the same way any other child's would be.
The death penalty is a just and fair punishment for certain crimes.
The death penalty is wrong and should not be used as a punishment.
It is wrong and cruel for the government to take someone's life as a form of punishment for a crime.
Some crimes are so heinous that the only fair punishment for them is death.
There should be greater economic regulation.
There should be less economic regulation.
There is not enough economic regulation, especially on large corporations.
There is too much economic regulation, which especially hurts small businesses
The United States is a fundamentally capitalistic nation and should avoid all socialistic policies.
The United States should incorporate more socialistic policies in order to balance out the issues of rampant capitalism
Capitalism is the best economic system and has allowed the United States to flourish into one of the most successful economies in the world.
Unrestricted capitalism is a bad system which has created historic levels of wealth inequality in the United States.
The Government should put more money into improving public education rather than wasting it on school vouchers.
School vouchers allow parents to decide for themselves which school their child should go to and should receive more funding.
Public schools have been neglected by the government and need greater funding.
Public schools do not provide the best education for many children and so the government should financially support other forms of schooling, such as charter schools.
Oil and gas usage should not be restricted since these resources plentiful in the United States and help keep energy affordable.
Renewable energy is the future and we should move to it as quickly as possible.
Renewable energy sources are not currently capable of handling the country's energy demands and so we should continue to use fossil fuels.
Fossil fuels are an environmentally-unclean and outdated source of energy.
Climate change is one of the biggest threats the world faces today.
Climate change is not a significant threat and we don't need to take drastic action to stop it.
If we don't act fast, the effects of climate change will continue to get worse and cause irreparable damage.
The dangers of climate change are exaggerated and are not currently a significant concern.
The right to own guns is a fundamental right which the government should not restrict.
Gun ownership must be strictly regulated in order to preserve people's safety.
The Constitution makes clear that people have the right to own guns.
The government is well within its rights to restrict and regulate gun ownership
Healthcare is a human right and the government should do everything it can to make sure that everyone has access to affordable health care.
The healthcare system requires healthy competition and a market free of government intervention in order to provide people with the best deal.
It is the government's responsibility to provide healthcare and healthcare programs like Medicare and Medicaid should be expanded to meet this need.
Greater government intervention in healthcare would lead to lower-quality care and an overall worse healthcare system.
The United States has a long history of immigration and should continue to welcome immigrants searching for a better life.
The United States must maintain strict control over who can and cannot immigrate and is well within its right to impose fair requirements for immigration.
Undocumented immigrants should be allowed to stay in the United States and given a fair pathway to citizenship.
The United States has a legal immigration system and everyone who wants to immigrate must go through it if they want to stay.
Separation of church and state is an extremely important principle and it means that religion must be kept out of government.
The government should not do anything which could endanger the free practice of religion and must do everything possible to uphold religious liberty.
The government must ensure that laws and regulations are kept free of religion and religious influence.
Religion and faith are an important part of American life and so the government must uphold these values.
Higher taxes may be necessary in order to provide citizens with the services they need.
Taxes need to be reduced, even if that requires government programs to be cut.
The government needs to provide more services to its citizens, even if that means raising taxes.
Taxes are too high and the government must reduce them, even if that causes government programs to be weakened or cut.
Welfare services allow the poor to support themselves and help them get back on their feet.
Welfare services cause people to become dependent on the government and prevent them from improving their lives.
The poorest in our society need welfare programs (e.g. food stamps) to help them survive.
The poor should be enouraged to improve their lives through grit and determination, and welfare programs undermine that goal.
